I'd say this is the best half-life expansion/spin-off. 
It has it's unique weapons and this time it's a bit shorter than half-life. There are new NPC's which are unique too and are only seen in opposing force. The first is a medic which is self explanetory. The other is the engineer which helps you kick off doors that are locked by welding them. And the training course is unique too by replicating a basic training camp for soldiers.
that's my review and i hope you like it! :)

Not as well developed of a story line as the original, but the expanded weaponry is a lot more fun. I do miss the crowbar though, the night vision goggles are harder to see with than the flashlight, and the glitchy ladders are still a thing. A good expansion overall, and worth the few extra hours after playing HL1.
As I played this game for 11 hours I can tell that this game makes your life cut in half

Definitely the best expansion for the original Half-Life. Finally, get into Combine's shoes and defeat all those f*****g aliens! The story is very nice, deep and intense, the game is long enough and never gets boring.
This game begins with a military tutorial and follows the story of Black Mesa from a different perspective (the other ones are the original Gordon Freeman and the other expansion Barney Calhoun), to defeat the grand mother of all aliens. We'll also encounter some known characters and familiar places. Cheap and very worthy.

Pros:

+ Still the good old HL engine
+ Very deep and intense story
+ Charismatic characters
+ Reasonably long but not too much for an expansion
+ Cheap

Cons:

- Some tricky situations need thinking

I definitely recommend this game, it's the conclusion of HL1 with the original and intense different perspective. The military one.

Лучше, чем Half-Life: Blue Shift. Тут большое количество нового оружия, новых монстров и механик, даже кое-какие проблески сюжета появляются. Но всё равно утомительно. Должно быть, я просто не фанат старых игр, где само наличие головоломок и перестрелок уже большой плюс. Не отрицаю, что раньше это был отличный продукт, но сейчас рекомендовать не смогу, сейчас есть игры, которые дадут за 6 часов игры незабываемые ощущения, а не такой проходняк.

Время полного неспешного прохождения ~ 6 часов.
Pro Tip: if you're having problem´s with you're mouse, then go to options then go to mouse and then turn on raw mouse input

Пожалуй, лучшая часть из серии Half-Life. Откровенно говоря, я всегда считал Гордона Фримена неполноценным дегенеративным куском дepьмa с пробитым от монтировки очком. Благо, Valve дала прекрасную возможность почувствовать себя в шкуре брутального, отважного и непобедимого Адриана Шепарда, а не какого-то там бездарного очкарика, который без своего петушиного костюмчика способен разве что только на мытье унитазов.
A really good DLC for the original game. It expands on the story from the enemy view point. Lots of action and fighting but only a few hours long. A must play classic for any Half Life fan.

One of the best expansion packs to a major title, and is still one of my favourite GoldSrc engine games.

Instead of reusing the same default assets from the base game, Opposing Force offers a ton of content that makes the game's playtime length appear longer than it is. It strangely has this replayability value, that I never get bored of playing despite the run time I had with Opposing Force.

It's more half life! It's perfect!
The best of the Half Life DLC. I would definitely consider this one a must play compared to the other DLC.

Before I give my thoughts on the game, I want to let you know this. I read that Opposing Force was a buggy mess. Well I played it, and I can confirm that those issues have been fixed by Gearbox. There may still be bugs though, so I recommend downloading patches online, such as the single player maps fix.

Ok, so my thoughts on the game are this. It's excellent. While Blue Shift is splendid, this is still a great game. New weapons and enemies are available here, along with new mechanics. You play as Adrian Shephard, who is a HECU Marine. You know, the enemies you faced in the original game? You're not a villain here, although you can be one if you so desire. You can play as someone else if you wish by changing the player.mdl file. Here's how it's done. The explanation also applies to Half-Life (valve folder) and Blue Shift (bshift folder). Be sure to make a backup copy of the original player file by the way.

------------

Ok, so you download a player skin of your choice. You'll see a folder containing a .mdl file inside it. Copy and paste that file over to the models folder in Gearbox and/or Gearbox_hd. Then you rename that file to player.mdl and there, you have the character you downloaded as the protagonist.

Warning, there's a player folder in the models folder. That's for the multiplayer, and doesn't effect the campaign. The single player uses a unique model with the player.mdl file.

------------

Single player is not really that short. It doesn't have a long tram ride like HL. Instead, you get right to the action, which is a plus for me. It's very fun! I will say the final boss is too easy though. Now the multiplayer...it's glorious. It's a big upgrade from Half-Life's multiplayer, you get the original weapons from HL along with the ones introduced in OP, new maps, and a new game mode called Capture The Flag. By default the game doesn't have bots, but you can install them if you wish. There's still players online incase you're wondering. You can download custom made content online, which increase the fun even more! Definitely get this game. You'll love it.

Öncelikle bu oyunu bir çeşit ara sayılabilir.İlk Half Life'ı  oynadıktan sonra oynamanızı tavsiye ederim daha rahat etmeniz açısından.İlk oyunla paralel zamanlarda geçiyor ve biz farklı bir açıdan olaylara dahil oluyoruz ve genel olay örgüsü biraz daha netleşiyor.
Bölümler harika bir akıcılıkta ilerliyor. İlk oyuna nazaran daha kısa sürede bitti bu yüzden ara oyun sayıyorum.Ancak aksiyon daha fazla. Daha çeşitli ve zor düşmanlar daha farklı bilim-kurgu silahları var çeşitlilik ve zorluk biraz daha artmış.
Farklı mekaniklerde yer yer kullanılıyor ve parkur çeşitliliği sağlamış.
Eski bir oyun evet ama ,indirimde denk getirirseniz, denemenizi tavsiye ederim.

Another hit on Gold Source. One your pocket book won't mind a bit come the steam holiday sales. Where these vintage games go on offer for pennies almost.

Now, Half-Life: Opposing Force, much like Blue Shift, was a game I have intended to play for many years. I'd started it over a friend's house, never finished it. Started up the tutorial and first level a few times, but never got around to really stepping into it. And now I have finished the game, and I have this to say.

I was honestly very happy with the expansion. And it deserves its place as one of the best out there.

Now, two caveats. Just like with blue shift, I needed to go into options and use hardware mouse configuration to get the game to actually read my mouse while playing (main menu and pause was fine), and the game REALLY hates dual-screen configuration. The cursor does not lock in the application, and the subtle drift means occasionally your cursor might go over to the other window, or escape the window bounds at the bottom, left, or top depending on your settings. This was really frustrating sometimes, but... We lived.

The enemies and challenge of the game was appropriate. And really helped sell the experience of a Valve expression of the Half-Life universe. Even moreso, aliens that hadn't made it into Half-Life 2 that I never saw before. Unique tech and weapons. Lots of interesting things! 

The game felt well paced, for the most part. The beginning felt longer than any other (preceding Alyx), but perhaps I am mistaken. There might be a small complaint in that by the end of the game, it was somewhat tricky to remember what column the weapon I wanted was in... AS there sure were a lot of weapons.

But that meant there were a lot of enemies. And a lot of enemies who needed shot. And that's what Adrian Shepherd did best perhaps.

Recommend giving it a try if you're every running vintage, and want to experience Gold Source.

Half-Life: Opposing Force é um jogo paralelo à franquia Half-Life, desenvolvido pela Gearbox ao invés da Valve. Embora o jogo não seja explicitamente considerado na continuidade da franquia, muitos fãs o consideram como cânon. Em Opposing Force, você controla um dos soldados que foi enviado ao Complexo de Pesquisas Black Mesa para conter o desastre vivenciado em Half-Life. Embora a jogabilidade e gráficos sejam essencialmente os mesmos, o jogo traz uma história original, assim como novas armas e inimigos, mas a trilha sonora não se destaca muito. Mesmo assim, se você gostou de Half-Life, vale a pena jogar Opposing Force.

This game is great! It shows a great new perspective on the Half-Life story. It's harder, there's more weapons, not all of which I like, but they're certainly interesting. The new enemies are good, and much more challenging than most of the original game's enemies. The levels are great and have a fair amount of variety, with a few pushing your ammo limits and making for some tense moments in the dark. This really is worth playing if you're a fan of Half-Life and have somehow missed it
